definition: to express a different view/to take a different position
to sing/to call loudly/to chant
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: If no overcapacity, it is clear that it is disgreeing with MIIT.
sentences.chinese: 如果說產能不過剩，擺明了是跟工信部唱反調。

sentences.english: Do not neglect this on your site.
sentences.chinese: 別在你的網站上唱反調。

sentences.english: Accept constructive criticism, but ignore naysayers.
sentences.chinese: 接受建設性的批評，但是忽略那些老唱反調的人。

sentences.english: We dare not oppose the central government.
sentences.chinese: 我們哪敢跟中央政府唱反調。

sentences.english: Now, start playing Devil's Advocate and challenge yourself to find the positive.
sentences.chinese: 現在開始喜歡唱反調以及挑戰自己尋找積極面。

sentences.english: Less trust and more cantankerousness might not necessarily be a bad thing, however, Hamann and his group wrote.
sentences.chinese: 然而，將信將疑，愛唱反調也並不一定是件壞事。

sentences.english: what was he trying to un-throne, dethrone in Aristotle?
sentences.chinese: 他在那些方面和亞里士多德唱反調呢？

sentences.english: I've faced lots of naysayers every step of the way.
sentences.chinese: 在我走的每一步當中我已經遇到很多唱反調的。

sentences.english: No matter what I do , he always kick aganist.
sentences.chinese: 不論我做什麼，他總是要和我唱反調。

sentences.english: Joe often gets into fights because he is always looking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 跟人家唱反調，你是在自找爭吵。

definition: to incite disharmony/to instigate
unpleasant talk/malicious words
to bear grudges
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
obedient/to comply/to submit/to defer
to annoy/annoying/irritating/troublesome
